titleStmt.title: [The] merry boys of Christmas, or The milk-maids new-years-gift. When lads and lasses take delight, together for to be; they pass away the winter night, and live most merrily. To the tune of, Hey boys up go we.

[The] merry boys of Christmas, or The milk-maids new-years-gift. When lads and lasses take delight, together for to be; they pass away the winter night, and live most merrily. To the tune of, Hey boys up go we.

notesStmt.note: Place and date of publication from Wing CD-ROM, 1996.
Verse: "Come, come my roaring ranting boys,".
Imperfect: copy stained and cut; top and right side of sheet, including imprint, wanting.
Reproduction of original in the British Library.
